verses.kjv: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
verses.ct: A stale crust of bread eaten in peace is better than a house full of feasting with conflict.

verses.kjv: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
verses.ct: A wise servant will gain authority over a disgraceful son and will share in the inheritance among the brothers.

verses.kjv: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.
verses.ct: The crucible tests silver and the furnace tests gold, but the LORD tests hearts.

verses.kjv: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
verses.ct: An evildoer pays attention to destructive talk, and a liar listens eagerly to a malicious tongue.

verses.kjv: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
verses.ct: Whoever mocks the poor insults their Maker, and anyone who celebrates disaster will not escape punishment.

verses.kjv: Children’s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
verses.ct: Grandchildren are the pride of the elderly, and the glory of children is their parents.

verses.kjv: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
verses.ct: Eloquent speech doesn't fit a fool — how much less do lying lips fit a ruler.

verses.kjv: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
verses.ct: A bribe works like a magic charm for the one who gives it; wherever he turns, he succeeds.

verses.kjv: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
verses.ct: Whoever forgives an offense builds love, but whoever keeps bringing it up drives close friends apart.

verses.kjv: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
verses.ct: A single correction impacts a wise person more deeply than 100 lashes affect a fool.

verses.kjv: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
verses.ct: A rebellious person looks only for trouble, so a merciless agent will be sent against him.

verses.kjv: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.ct: Better to run into a mother bear whose cubs have been taken than to encounter a fool caught up in his stupidity.

verses.kjv: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
verses.ct: Whoever repays good with evil will never see trouble leave his household.

verses.kjv: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
verses.ct: Starting a quarrel is like opening a floodgate — so walk away from the dispute before it erupts.

verses.kjv: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
verses.ct: Acquitting the guilty and condemning the innocent — the LORD detests them both.

verses.kjv: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?
verses.ct: What good is money in a fool's hand to buy wisdom when he has no desire to learn?

verses.kjv: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.ct: A true friend shows love at all times, and a brother is born to help in times of hardship.

verses.kjv: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
verses.ct: A person who lacks sense shakes hands on a deal and puts up collateral for someone else's debt.

verses.kjv: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
verses.ct: Whoever loves conflict loves sin, and whoever builds his gate high invites destruction.

verses.kjv: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
verses.ct: A person with a twisted mind will never find success, and someone with a deceitful tongue will fall into trouble.

verses.kjv: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.
verses.ct: The parent of a fool has nothing but grief; there is no joy in fathering a senseless child.

verses.kjv: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
verses.ct: A joyful heart is great medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.

verses.kjv: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
verses.ct: A corrupt person secretly accepts a bribe to twist the course of justice.

verses.kjv: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
verses.ct: Wisdom stays right in front of a person who has understanding, but a fool's attention wanders to the far corners of the earth.

verses.kjv: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
verses.ct: A foolish son brings grief to his father and bitter pain to the mother who gave birth to him.

verses.kjv: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
verses.ct: It is wrong to punish an innocent person, and it is wrong to flog honorable leaders for their integrity.

verses.kjv: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
verses.ct: A person with knowledge uses few words, and someone with understanding keeps a calm temperament.

verses.kjv: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.ct: Even a fool who stays quiet is considered wise; keeping your mouth shut makes you seem intelligent.
